text: this is the most devilish of devil's
food cake because I'm using two
frostings I have a black pepper
buttercream and a chocolate fudge
frosting so I've already made the cakes
you can do that a couple of days ahead
if you want I did it this morning and
I'm going to show you how to make the
buttercream in this bowl I've got my egg
whites I have sugar in just a little bit
of salt making a little double boiler
what you want to do is cook the sugar
directly into the egg whites and the
important thing is you want to whisk it
constantly because you don't want the
egg whites to cook so the point is to
dissolve the sugar into the egg white
and the way that you can tell that
you've done this is you just take your
fingers you take a little bit of egg
white and you just feel it and if you
feel any little grains keep cooking it
but if it feels nice and smooth like
this one then you know you've dissolved
it to know what you want to do is you
want to beat this with an electric mixer
until it becomes really fluffy and stiff
and you need to make sure that your egg
whites are cooled because if you put the
butter into the hot egg whites they're
just gonna melt and you are gonna end up
with a puddle and not a fluffy icing you
just want it to be very very slightly
lukewarm or the same temperature as your
finger that's fine too and then turn the
mixer on and add the butter a little bit
at a time just give the side to scrape
and now I'm just gonna add my black
pepper these are the seeds that I've
scraped out of a vanilla bean you could
also just use vanilla extract but these
have a lot more flavor a lot more
perfume
so what the black pepper does is it adds
a slight bite and also makes it more
interesting than your average vanilla
buttercream however if you are worried
about say small children not liking the
black pepper you can leave it out and
then this one's ready to go now I'm
gonna do the chocolate frosting the
chocolate fudge frosting is really a lot
like making chocolate fudge except even
easier so what I'm gonna do first is
again dissolve the sugar that's just
heavy cream sugar so you want to make
sure that you turn the heat off before
you add the chocolate so that the
chocolate doesn't burn and then it's
gonna melt pretty immediately got
vanilla extract butter and when this is
perfectly smooth you can transfer it
into a bowl and we're gonna then beat it
in an ice bath this bowl fits in nicely
okay so here's something when you're
doing this you want to wear an apron and
then that's what it looks like when it's
done you can see that it's a little bit
thicker lighter and it looks like
frosting the reason I cut my cake layers
in half is that instead of a three layer
cake I wanted a six layer cake that
means there's more room for frosting see
all those little crumbs that are getting
in there people will think they're
vanilla and pepper so it won't even look
messy so this is really lopsided which
is the sign of a homemade cake I'm gonna
do is I'm gonna build up a little bit
extra frosting here and then when I put
the top layer on it will all will just
look amazing yeah check it out now the
chocolate frosting is gonna hide all
sins
this one you have to be a little bit
more careful with crumbs because they
will show up not too bad in the end
right looks pretty good
finally a recipe with more frosting than
cake because isn't that the best part
mm-hmm
all
